1_Home Row.Introduction: The first principle of touch typing is to always return your fingers to the Home Row (A S D F for left fingers ( ( J K L ; for right fingers ) when you are not typing. The home row is the base point from which you will learn the positions of all the other keys. Most keyboards have small bumps on the f and j keys to help you find the home row without looking at the keys.
1_Home Row.Objective: Introduction to home keys and learn to type with right and left hand

1_The Right Hand.Title: The Right Hand
Content: The home row keys for the right hand are: j k l ;

Place your right hand so that your index finger is positioned on j, your middle finger is on k, your ring finger is on l and your little finger is on ; (the semicolon key). Let your right thumb rest on the spacebar at the bottom of the keyboard.
Our first touch typing lesson introduces 2 home row keys for the right hand: j k

Typing Exercise left hand fingers (Position your Right hand according to the above image and start typing, use right thumb for space bar)jjj spacebar right thumb jjj spacebar jjj spacebar kkk…Start exercise..

2_The Left Hand.Title: The Left Hand
Content: The home row keys for the Left hand are f d s a

Place your left hand so that your index finger is on f, your middle finger is on d, your ring finger is on s and your little finger in on a. Your thumb can rest on the spacebar. We will begin with the first
2 left hand keys: <strong> f d. Type fff spacebar(left thumb)fff spacebar ddd  <strong>

3_Both Hands.Title: Both Hands
Content: The following typing exercise combines all the keys we have learned so far: j k l ; f d s a
Practice: jjj fff jjj fff jjj fff kkk ddd kkk ddd kkk ddd lll sss lll sss lll sss ;;; aaa ;;; aaa ;;; aaa jkl; jkl; jkl; fdsa fdsa fdsa jjj kkk lll ;;; fff ddd sss aaa jfj jfj jfj jkj jkj jkj kdk kdk kdk kjk kjk kjk l;l l;l l;l ;l; ;l; ;l; fdf fdf fdf dfd dfd dfd sas sas sas asa asa asa

4_H and G.Title: H and G
Content: The keys we have covered so far can all be typed without moving your fingers from the home row position. Now it is time to learn how to move your fingers off the home row to reach the h and g keys. To reach these new keys, you will need to move your index fingers to the sides. Practice extending your right index finger to the left to hit the h key. Then try reaching to the right with your left index finger for the g key. Afterwards, always remember to return your fingers to the home keys.
Practice: hhh hhh hhh hhh ggg ggg ggg ggg hhh ggg hhh ggg hhh ggg hgh hgh hgh hgh ghg ghg ghg ghg hhh hhh hhh ggg ggg ggg hg hg hg gh gh gh hh gg hg gh gh hg hh hg gg gh h h h h g g g g h g g h h g g h hgh hhg ghh ggh hgg ggg hhh ghg

5_All together.Title: All together
Content: Congratulations! You have learned to type the home row and covered more than a third of the alphabet! Let's practice the exercise below.

2_Top Row.Introduction: Congratulations! On completing week 1 and lesson 1! Now you are a master on the home row! Now you are ready to type the top row! Please remember to keep your finger always on the home keys before starting the typing. You move your fingers from home keys to upwards, downwards, left and right side to type.
2_Top Row.Objective: To know the “Top Row and Keys” and learn to type with Index, Middle, Ring, and Little fingers of both hands.

1_Index Finger Keys.Title: Index Finger Keys
Content: We will start the lesson by learning the two keys above your left and right index fingers: u r

5_Y and T keys.Title: Y and T keys
Content: The y and t keys are the final 2 top row keys. You will reach these keys by moving your index fingers up and to the side. Practice extending your right index finger up and to the left to hit the y key. Then try reaching up and to the right with your left index finger for the t key.

6_Typing Simple Words.Title: Typing Simple Words
Content: Fantastic! You have now covered more than two thirds of the alphabet! Let's put all those letters to use and work on typing some words.
Practice: the four lads stood quietly atop the tower; pear salad is a great quirky dish; plaid dads play golf; slide the glass to your good pal; we gladly yapped for two hours; wade through the water to us; either of us will go; we used our gold goose eggs well; let us do tea for two; go forward to the other side; other ghosts will spook us; the riders had quite a lot of leg power; you see how easy it is to type the top row; a little further to go yet; i wish i had read the flyer fully; read it for us please; joe sipped jade tea jealously; kate flew her fast kite sky high;

3_Bottom Row.Introduction: You are almost done with the basic keys! It is time to learn to type the bottom row.
3_Bottom Row.Objective: Be able to type last two Bottom Row keys

1_Index Finger Keys.Title: Index Finger Keys
Content: We will begin by learning to type the two keys below your right and left index fingers: m v

Content: It's time to learn the ring finger keys: . x

5_n an b.Title: n an b
Content: The n and b keys are the final 2 bottom row keys. You will reach these keys by moving your index fingers down and to the side. Practice extending your right index finger down and to the left to hit the n key. Then try reaching down and to the right with your left index finger for the b key.
Practice: nnn nnn nnn nnn bbb bbb bbb bbb nnn bbb nnn bbb nnn bbb nbn nbn nbn nbn bnb bnb bnb bnb nnn nnn nnn bbb bbb bbb nb nb nb bn bn bn nn bb nb bn bn nb nn nb bb bn n n n n b b b b n b b n n b b n nbn nnb bnn bbn nbb bbb nnn bnb

6_Typing with words.Title: Typing with words
Content: Congratulations! You have learned to type all the letters in the alphabet, as well as basic punctuation keys. Let's put them all together!
Practice: zebras are not exactly known for being quiet animals. she/he would very likely just play along for a while. you can make quite a lot of lemon zes with even larger sized lemons; please cover each plate. six foxes quickly woke axel; just in time. i caught five jelly fish, six octopus and two SE urchins for my buddy ben. eight / six is exactly equal to four / three

4_Capital Letters.Introduction: Now that you know all the letter keys, let's learn to type them in capitals. To type the capital case of any letter, hold down the shift key while typing the letter key. You will notice there are two shift keys on your keyboard - one on each side. You should press the shift key with either left or right hand little finger.
4_Capital Letters.Objective: Be able to type Capital Letter Keys with Left Hand

1_Right Hand Capital Letter.Title: Right Hand Capital Letter
Content: We will begin typing capital letters with the right hand while using the left shift key.
Practice: JJJ JJJ JJJ KKK KKK KKK LLL LLL LLL JjJ JjJ JjJ KkK KkK KkK L1L L1L L1L Jjj Jjj Jjj Kkk Kkk Kkk L11 L11 L11 HHH HHH HHH HhH HhH HhH Hhh Hhh Hhh UUU UUU UUU III III III 000 000 000 PPP PPP PPP UuU UuU UuU III III Ill 000 000 000 PpP PpP PpP Uuu Uuu Uuu Iii Iii Iii Ooo Ooo Ooo Ppp Ppp Ppp YYY YYY YYY YyY YyY YyY Yyy Yyy Yyy MMM MMM MMM MmM MmM MmM Mmm Mmm Mmm NNN NNN NNN NnN NnN NnN Nnn Nnn Nnn

Content: Now let's practice typing left hand letters with the right shift key.

3_Capital Letters on Both Hands.Title: Capital Letters on Both Hands
Content: Let's put both hands together and practice switching between left and right hand shift keys.
Practice: WOW. Four Jacks And One Queen, I Win. Please Do Not Go Up There Now. Zack Needs MORE Caramel Kettle Corn ASAP. Nobody Even HAS Any Purple Vests. Xavier Let Seventy Yellow BEES Into Our Cabin. YIKES. Good Lemons Are HARD To Pick. Do Not Watch Karen; She Is VERY Nervous.
